oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from William M. Thurman to wife Margaret
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Written to his wife Margaret in Lynnville (Tenn.) from the Confederate fortifications at Port Hudson (La." he speaks mostly of domestic affairs: "Children if you don't mind and doo right I will paddle you when I come [home]." Port Hudson, along with Vicksburg, was among the last fortified spots on the Mississippi River controlled by the Confederacy in early 1863.
